sentences.sContent: “No matter how he stuffs his readers with verbiage, it never amounts to a core of truth, ” he said.
sentences.sContent_eng: “No matter how he stuffs his readers with verbiage, it never amounts to a core of truth, ” he said.
sentences.sCn: “不管他如何用废话喂饱他的读者，那些话都毫无真实可言，”他说。

sentences.sContent: On his first visit to the US, and in his maiden address to the UN general assembly, Gaddafi fully lived up to his reputation for eccentricity, bloody-mindedness and extreme verbiage.
sentences.sContent_eng: On his first visit to the US, and in his maiden address to the UN general assembly, Gaddafi fully lived up to his reputation for eccentricity, bloody-mindedness and extreme verbiage.
sentences.sCn: 这是卡扎菲首次访问美国，也是他第一次在联大发表演讲；而他的表现也没有辜负他“性情古怪、诚心找茬、废话连篇”的名声。

sentences.sContent: Even in little 140-character bites, that's a lot of verbiage.
sentences.sContent_eng: Even in little 140-character bites, that's a lot of verbiage.
sentences.sCn: 即使限制在一推140个字,也有很大一部分是废话。

remMethod.val: verb(字， 词)+i+age → 冗词， 废话

words.tran: 咬文嚼字；冗词；言语表达；套话
